ApproxsimClient.communication
Interface ApproxsimMessageListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultApproxsimMessageListener
public interface ApproxsimMessageListener
extends EventListener

This interface should be implemented by objects that are interested in receiving notifications about what happens with a ApproxsimMessage. Events are generated when:

The message is sent by the client to the server.

The answer to the message has been received.

The contents of the message has been processed by the XMLHandler

Something has gone wrong.

Method Summary
 void errorOccurred(ApproxsimMessageEvent e)
          Called when something has gone wrong during the process of sending the message and receiving and handling the answer.
 void messageHandled(ApproxsimMessageEvent e, Object reply)
          Called when the XMLHandler has processed the data in the answer message received from the server.
 void messageReceived(ApproxsimMessageEvent e)
          Called when the client has received the answer to the message from the server..
 void messageSent(ApproxsimMessageEvent e)
          Called when the client has sent the message to the server.
